parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (13240044) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign spending, and are mandated for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to Dragoș-Gabriel Zisopol, a candidate for the Uniunea Elenă din România party, participating in the parliamentary elections.  His name, party affiliation, and position on the ballot (24) are clearly stated. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Sibiu, Romania.  The use of hashtags (#UniuneaElena, #DragoșGabrielZisopol, #AlegeriParlamentare2024, #Diversitate, #Comunitate) further indicates an attempt to reach a broad public, not just a select few. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Dragoș-Gabriel Zisopol in the parliamentary elections. The call to action ("vâ invit să votați candidatul Uniunii Elene din România") explicitly aims to influence voting behavior. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and party, lacking the neutrality expected from journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly structured campaign advertisement designed to promote a candidate and party. The language used is promotional, not expressive of personal views.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>919000556854153</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It clearly identifies a candidate (Dragoș-Gabriel Zisopol), is used during the electoral campaign period (as indicated by the date and hashtags), has an explicit electoral objective (to garner votes), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's paid nature on a public platform like Facebook ensures wide dissemination.  There are no counterarguments to suggest otherwise.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>DRAGOȘ-GABRIEL ZISOPOL</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Uniunea Elenă din România</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Uniunea Elenă din România, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 919000556854153) cu scop electoral, care promovează candidatul Dragoș-Gabriel Zisopol pentru alegerile parlamentare, incluzând un apel explicit la vot ("vâ invit să votați candidatul Uniunii Elene din România") și un număr CMF (13240044),  constituind astfel propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.  Postarea, având în vedere caracterul plătit și diseminarea pe o platformă publică precum Facebook, are un efect electoral clar, vizând influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
